title: Count for issues found vs issues that can be fixed is wacky
body:
Running `psalm --show-info=false` on CakePHP [4.x](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/tree/4.x) generates the following result.

```
------------------------------
No errors found!
------------------------------
34 other issues found.
------------------------------
Psalm can automatically fix 36 of them.
Run Psalm again with 
--alter --issues=MissingParamType --dry-run
to see what it can fix.
------------------------------
```

So it claims to be able to fix 2 more issues than it has found :slightly_smiling_face:.

Running `psalm --alter --issues=MissingParamType --dry-run` as suggested results in output:

```
/path/to/cake-apps/cakephp/src/Core/ObjectRegistry.php:
--- /path/to/cakephp/src/Core/ObjectRegistry.php
+++ /path/to/cakephp/src/Core/ObjectRegistry.php
@@ -328,8 +328,10 @@
      * be attached into the event manager
      *
      * @param string $objectName The name of the object to set in the registry.
-     * @param object $object instance to store in the registry
+     * @param TObject $object
+     *
      * @psalm-param TObject $object
+     *
      * @return $this
      */
     public function set(string $objectName, object $object)

------------------------------
No errors found!
------------------------------
```

I would not expect any change to be done here. `@param object $object` should not be modified since `@psalm-param TObject $object` already exists.

Also what about the other 30+ errors it claimed to have found / can fix?
